properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A snowstorm is expected. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-13T20:52:41-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-13T04:52:41-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1097089002.2020
Area: Coquihalla Highway - Hope to Merritt
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring. A weak disturbance over the central Yukon has generated strong east winds of 60 km/h gusting 80 near the Richardson Mountains this afternoon. These strong winds will persist tonight then ease near midday Friday. Reduced visibility in blowing snow and cold wind chills down to minus 30 are expected. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-13T15:47:36-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-12T23:48:36-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3024306716.2020
Area: Dempster
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 25 cm is expected. Heavy snow has developed over Whistler and the Sea to Sky Highway north of Squamish this evening. Snow at times heavy is expected to continue through tonight and into Friday morning. Snow will ease to a few flurries Friday morning. Additional snowfall amounts of 10 to 15 cm are expected. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-13T19:44:31-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-13T03:45:31-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3344795385.2020
Area: Whistler
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. A low pressure centre over the South Coast on Friday morning will move into the southern BC interior in the afternoon. In the wake of the low, westerly winds of 70 km/h gusting to 90 will develop in Greater Victoria near Juan de Fuca Strait. The winds will ease on Friday evening. ### High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-13T15:33:21-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-12T23:34:21-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1428890706.2020
Area: Greater Victoria
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 25 cm is expected. A Pacific frontal system will spread snow at times heavy into the West Kootenay region tonight. The snow will persist through Friday morning and then become mixed with rain in the valley bottoms during the afternoon. General snowfall accumulations will be 15 to 20 cm with greater amounts expected over higher terrain. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-13T15:08:40-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-12T23:09:40-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4121739787.2020
Area: West Kootenay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. A Pacific frontal system will move across the BC interior tonight through Friday. Snow is expected to intensify overnight and persist through Friday. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 20 cm except 40 cm near Fernie can be expected before the snow tapers off to a few flurries early Saturday morning. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-13T15:07:21-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-12T23:08:21-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0542925410.2020
Area: Elk Valley
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. A Pacific frontal system will move across the BC interior tonight through Friday. Snow at times heavy will begin tonight and persist through Friday. Total snow accumulations up to 40 cm can be expected before the snow tapers off to a few flurries early Saturday morning. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-13T15:11:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-12T23:12:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1608278232.2020
Area: Highway 3 - Paulson Summit to Kootenay Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of about 15 cm is expected. A Pacific frontal system moving across the BC interior will bring snow to the Boundary region this evening into Friday morning. Temperatures will rise above freezing by Friday afternoon allowing the snow to become mixed with rain. Total snowfall amounts tonight through Friday morning are expected to be near 15 cm. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-13T15:08:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-12T23:09:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2577550082.2020
Area: Boundary
properties.Author: Environment Canada
